text:
Australia won’t start til mid-late Feburary or something.
Which is good, since its basically a waste to send the vaccines to Australia where there is no covid.
In fact it should be later.
but it does mean I am unlikely to be able to go home for a very long time…

text: Correct. I miss Australia. It’s been over 2 years since I saw my family

elements.text: Correct. I miss Australia. It’s been over 2 years since I saw my family

text: Mhm, I'm sorry to hear that. Presumably if you get vaccinated in the UK, you can go home though, right? I guess flights and such are still massively expensive.

elements.text: Mhm, I'm sorry to hear that. Presumably if you get vaccinated in the UK, you can go home though, right? I guess flights and such are still massively expensive.

text:
Yeah, it’s about the cost of flights. they need to start allowing more than 1200 people into Western Australia per week before it is viable to airlines to sell economy class tickets.
They won’t do that til Australia is less paranoid.

Possibly though once vaccinated my wife and I might be able to skip the secure quarantine, which would save paying several thousand dollars.

text: judging by most responses by the federal government to date, I'd expect general availability sometime in 2022 :confused:
